message_1: What happens when copper is placed in a solution of silver nitrate? Write the chemical equation for the reaction that occurs and determine which element is being replaced in the reaction.
message_2:
When copper is placed in a solution of silver nitrate, a single displacement reaction occurs. Copper replaces silver in the silver nitrate solution, forming copper nitrate and solid silver. The chemical equation for this reaction is:

Cu(s) + 2AgNO3(aq) â†’ Cu(NO3)2(aq) + 2Ag(s)

In this reaction, silver (Ag) is being replaced by copper (Cu).
